tldr: Multiple constant-time implementations in wolfSSL prior to version 5.8.4 may be converted into non-constant-time binaries due to LLVM compiler optimizations. This can introduce observable timing differences, potentially leading to information disclosure via timing side-channel attacks.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version that falls within the vulnerable range.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `wolfSSL.wolfssl` library to the patch version.
